channel.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
channel.description:
After my release off playing with Pokemon earlier. I was persuaded by a majority over msn to continue the development into a multiplayer game. So, I scrapped out everything and started afresh due to the learning curve being eminent in the previous release.
The final design concept will consist of Netty networking, a game world and a lobby world integrated chat system for talk between game world to lobby world. Will also do the battling nonsense and gym leaders and most maps. I'll include and finish my map editor for the ability to make your own maps. Also will include plugins to create own pokemon, ect, ect.
New Media: [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/2d2855w.jpg[/img]
Lobby: [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/1hdm37.png[/img]
I have finished Pokemon definition packer, and loader. Simple junk, plus trainer (player) loader/saver for login. This weekend if I get time I'll do multiplayer.
Old media: [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2d11hjn.png[/img] [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/ekrdl5.png[/img] [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/23i83gg.png[/img] [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/28sqahg.png[/img]
Yay... child hood all over again.

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Taharok:

To be honest, I’m more interested in seeing it completed than being different. Once you have something playable, then you should focus on making it better than what’s already out there. People underestimate the difficulty of actually completing a project of this magnitude. Kudos to you, so far.

It is easier to design in future concepts while designing the initial framework and systems. Although I’m a bit of a perfectionist on bits of things to make sure there is no imminent problems or bugs/ect with things before progressing.

Finally starting on the in game portion of the game.

This is by far going to be the hardest part of the project, everything else is extremely easy compared to the amount of time and effort it is going to take to complete this.

Read full topic

item.description:

Borrowed Idea from Pokemon Online, recreated everything myself.

2ahd4wl.jpg1280×677

Going to most likely redraw a lot of visual aspects of the client.

Not much progress as I haven’t had much time for computer related activities.

Finished main panel + exception panels.

Did custom font loading…

Simple stuff.

Edit:

21cugs5.png809×609

t89lxi.png812×614

Button right icon is off by one freaking pixel in both the background and the image. I’ll deal with it later. I’m saving all images and psd file so others can modify them to their needs if they don’t like them :3

That is what the new game frame is going to look like. Still have a bit of work to do to it still. Stay in tuned ")

Need a bump so I can actually post new updates

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:16, topic:428953”][quote author=Pure Slay link=topic=531646.msg3888054#msg3888054 date=1326627415]
Although, I didn’t know that the player is positioned in the center. That actually helps a lot since I no longer have a game boy to play and see my self.
[/quote]Check out gameboy/advance emulation. It’s where you use emulation software to play original games. Basically a gameboy on your computer.[/quote]

I’ll most likely do that if I run out of people that keep telling me they will tell me their life experiences with Pokemon lol.

Worked a bit on remastering the lobby.

Image before I started on linking pane.
Basically linking is an area for sharing things between other users. Such as trading, single vs single battling, and other things I think of.

125qja9.png811×611

Working on World List:
Going to most likely have a mysql database linked to my website, where users can submit new entries for their servers. I’m not sure if I’ll keep the checkbox for if it is online or not. I might go with online and offline

Adding sand box for importing/exporting/creating new pokemon, maps, ect. That’ll take awhile to finish. I’ll prob end up calling it the PokeBox.

Edit:

Boom.

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Budda, post:14, topic:428953”][quote author=Pure Slay link=topic=531646.msg3888054#msg3888054 date=1326627415]
Finished my caching request (fetcher) system. It checks if you have the directory, files, and if the files are fully downloaded. If they aren’t fully downloaded it will start downloading from the last data in the file (doesn’t re download the whole file). Also it has capabilities for unpacking, ect. I just need to write my own container system for the files to save a lot of time and space with downloading. Thanks to Andrew for a few pointers on writing the design and a bug fix with writing from last position.
[/quote]

And this post has just given me another idea for something to make.

Keep em coming.[/quote]

Lol you’re welcome.

Working on dynamic screen loading, along with a loading video similar to how game boy had it, only this one will be a little custom.

2s9dcf7.jpg802×598

Loading Video & Audio… fun fun.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Pure Slay:

Finished my caching request (fetcher) system. It checks if you have the directory, files, and if the files are fully downloaded. If they aren’t fully downloaded it will start downloading from the last data in the file (doesn’t re download the whole file). Also it has capabilities for unpacking, ect. I just need to write my own container system for the files to save a lot of time and space with downloading. Thanks to Andrew for a few pointers on writing the design and a bug fix with writing from last position.

And this post has just given me another idea for something to make.

Keep em coming.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Lin:

Can’t really say anything positive here. Looks like every other Pokemon clone I’ve seen - a resizing window during gameplay due to, a non-fitting font, a bad blend of graphics, a failure in map scrolling with border tiles (the player should be at the middle of the map during ALL times - as if the world is scrolling around him/her), and laziness on the battle menu. People will notice the use of a different font slapped onto a screenshot of the battle screen, creating an unappealing blend. All these things might suck to do properly but you’re going to have an ugly product in the end if you don’t take the time to do them.

Please do note those are the previous version. I’ve rewritten everything from scratch. My interests are in engine performance then the looks. Although, I didn’t know that the player is positioned in the center. That actually helps a lot since I no longer have a game boy to play and see my self. So thanks Fonts are going to be loaded off a font file I downloaded off dafont, not what I used in that picture to get that portion finished.

ndlro4.png1280×720

Finished my caching request (fetcher) system. It checks if you have the directory, files, and if the files are fully downloaded. If they aren’t fully downloaded it will start downloading from the last data in the file (doesn’t re download the whole file). Also it has capabilities for unpacking, ect. I just need to write my own container system for the files to save a lot of time and space with downloading. Thanks to Andrew for a few pointers on writing the design and a bug fix with writing from last position.

Read full topic

People will notice the use of a different font slapped onto a screenshot of the battle screen, creating an unappealing blend. All these things might suck to do properly but you’re going to have an ugly product in the end if you don’t take the time to do them.

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:428953”]It shouldn’t lag… does it use lots of memory too? I can think of a few reasons that could cause it if it is…
My first note would be to put a FPS cap on it, which is done with a slick method.[/quote]

Well all applications ran through eclipse generally have a huge working set on my computer. Although the memory of the application is generally where all the other applications that I run are at. I just need to update my RAM and I’ll be good.

The FPS aren’t very high, or they don’t variant much either. That is why I’m not exactly sure if it is the program’s fault. I feel it is more my computer if anything.

Read full topic

It shouldn’t lag… does it use lots of memory too? I can think of a few reasons that could cause it if it is…
My first note would be to put a FPS cap on it, which is done with a slick method.

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:428953”]Wait so those maps are just projections of images of the old map? Ehhhh… lol
And why are you using swing? Why not your own components?

And I’m not sure about what you mean about flexibility with the tile sizes, it’s kinda a key part of tile based sprite games that they all be the same size or else you’ll run into issues.[/quote]

They were for testing, not for a long term thing. I like swing for the ease of drag & drop atm with eclipse. I can always go back and innovate new things after I get it started. Tile sizes I meant more of on some buildings there is an under layer that is misc size that is not a clean 8x8 tile.

I did a version in Slick w/ tiles and map generation

Lags kinda bad and recording doesn’t help that any. I think I might stay with my original painting methods as it is fast and doesn’t cause my applications to freeze. Only thing I enjoy about slick is the animation is clean for walking, ect.

Budda:

This has given me an idea for a new game. Thanks.

Your welcome I guess lol.

Read full topic

Wait so those maps are just projections of images of the old map? Ehhhh… lol
And why are you using swing? Why not your own components?

And I’m not sure about what you mean about flexibility with the tile sizes, it’s kinda a key part of tile based sprite games that they all be the same size or else you’ll run into issues.

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:428953”]Like, your themes are weird, and in once place it looks like a JButton and the other it looks like a real custom component button. Is this going to be open source? I could probably explain more about what I mean with a look at it.

As for the editor, you could take a look at this:
http://gamedev.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,512548.0.html

It’s been a while since I looked at the code and I could probably make it better, but you may just be able to use the ideas at least.

And I just remembered this, you may be able to use parts of it as it’s 2D sprite tile based as well…
http://code.google.com/p/unnamed-rpg/source/browse/trunk/RPG/#RPG%2Fsrc%2Fserver
http://code.google.com/p/unnamedrpgclient/source/browse/#svn%2Ftrunk%2FRPGCLIENT%2Fsrc%2Fclient

God that brings back memories haha. Was never completed, we got a basic skeleton done though[/quote]

Yes it will be open source. no point in making something if it isn’t useful to others. As for the button things. The login button, which I assume is what you are talking about, is a holder for where I’ll replace that with a sprite Image icon. The map editor stuff, I am adding the ability to add something similar to what you have there, although I want to add more flexibility then being forced to 32x32, 16x16, or 8x8 tiles. Tile mapping I know how to do, although with the images provided for every location of the Pokemon World, it was much easier to just use those sprites temporarily until I design my own maps.

Maps and that junk will be done after engine is complete. I like to start with performance issues before progressing to looks and abilities.

2nqfq54.png801×598

The play now button is an example of a JButton with the sprite.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Arsenal - Pokemon 2D Multiplayer
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:428953”]I’m a little concerned about the inconsistency of the GUI elements…

And what is that other button on the map editor next to refresh? It’s covered by the menu[/quote]

Could you expand a little on the first portion of your comment. The button covered is an open button, so you can choose another sprite map. I’m going to have a tabbed pane for the options of adding new images. That current design uses the mouse selection area to grab the area from the Left pane and repaints it onto the right pane where you click.

@Pure_Slay wrote:

After my release off playing with Pokemon earlier. I was persuaded by a majority over msn to continue the development into a multiplayer game. So, I scrapped out everything and started afresh due to the learning curve being eminent in the previous release.

The final design concept will consist of Netty networking, a game world and a lobby world integrated chat system for talk between game world to lobby world. Will also do the battling nonsense and gym leaders and most maps. I’ll include and finish my map editor for the ability to make your own maps. Also will include plugins to create own pokemon, ect, ect.

2d2855w.jpg800×603

Lobby:

I have finished Pokemon definition packer, and loader. Simple junk, plus trainer (player) loader/saver for login. This weekend if I get time I’ll do multiplayer.
